column4: hey guys, if I connect a usb mouse after system boots up, the mouse does not work, If I attach it before the boot, it works perfectly on Lucid. I can actually see in the system logs that the mouse is detected. Any ideas?
That is exactly what is supposed to happen.
Linux probes all the hardware and loads modules for the HW it finds.  Everytime on boot.  It's actually quite impressive.
How does a mouse "not work" if it isn't even plugged into the computer?
